item.title: Set theory
item.description: A neighborhood of \(p\) is a set \(N_r(p)\) consisting of all \(q\) such that \(d(p,q)<r\), for some \(r>0\). The \(r\) is called radius of \(N_r(p)\). A point \(p\) is called a limit point of the set \(E\), if every neighborhood of \(p\) contains a point \(q\ne p\) and \(q\in E\). \(E\) is closed if every limit point of \(E\) is a point of \(E\). \(p\) is called an interior point of \(E\) if there is a neighborhood \(N_r(p)\) of \(p\) such that \(N_r(p)\subset E\).
